title: How to Cook Fresh Sardines: Grilling, Frying & More

steps.title: Buy fresh sardines at the grocery store or fish market.
steps.content: Buy fresh sardines at the grocery store or fish market. [1] X Research source Look for whole fish that smell clean. Avoid bruised sardines-you want the best product when you make sardines. Stay away from old fish. Aged sardines will have "belly burn," a condition where the guts start to come out of the fish.

steps.title: Scale the sardines by holding them under cold running water.
steps.content: Scale the sardines by holding them under cold running water. When you prepare sardines, you want to remove all the rough skin. Rub your fingers back and forth over the sides, brushing off any remaining scales.

steps.title: Gut the sardines 1 at a time by holding the fish in one hand with the belly facing up.
steps.content: Gut the sardines 1 at a time by holding the fish in one hand with the belly facing up. To prepare sardines, cut the entire length of the fish's belly with a sharp fillet knife. Remove the innards and discard them. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the bones from the fish.
steps.content: Remove the bones from the fish. [3] X Research source Use the fillet knife to slice along each side of the backbone behind the ribs. Cut underneath the ribs of the fresh sardine and slice upward, away from the backbone. Use sharp scissors to snip the backbone where it connects to the head and where it meets the tail. Remove the backbones with your thumb and forefinger before you cook sardines. Start at the tail and move your hand along the bone toward the head. As you move along the spine, lift the bone from the fish.

steps.title: Rub the fish with lemon juice.
steps.content: Rub the fish with lemon juice. To prepare sardines, add a little seasoning, such as salt and pepper.

steps.title: Turn your grill on.
steps.content: Turn your grill on. If you use briquettes, give them plenty of time to heat up. The briquettes will be ready when they are almost completely gray. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Brush grape leaves with olive oil.
steps.content: Brush grape leaves with olive oil. When you make sardines, you want to keep them moist and juicy. Wrap each fish in a grape leaf.

steps.title: Cook sardines for 5 to 6 minutes on 1 side and then gently turn them over with kitchen tongs.
steps.content: Cook sardines for 5 to 6 minutes on 1 side and then gently turn them over with kitchen tongs. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Coat a frying pan with olive oil.
steps.content: Coat a frying pan with olive oil.

steps.title: Turn a stove burner on medium and place the pan on it.
steps.content: Turn a stove burner on medium and place the pan on it. Let the pan warm up for 3 to 5 minutes. To prepare sardines with a little more zest, dice up an onion and saut√© it for 4 minutes before you add the fish.

steps.title: Put the sardines in the frying pan, taking care not to splatter the hot oil.
steps.content: Put the sardines in the frying pan, taking care not to splatter the hot oil. Cook sardines on each side for 2 to 4 minutes, turning them over gently with kitchen tongs or a spatula.

steps.title: Turn your oven to broil and let it warm up for 10 minutes.
steps.content: Turn your oven to broil and let it warm up for 10 minutes. Prepare sardines for broiling by rubbing them with olive oil.

steps.title: Set the fresh sardines on a double-broiler pan and then put them in middle rack of the oven.
steps.content: Set the fresh sardines on a double-broiler pan and then put them in middle rack of the oven.

steps.title: Cook sardines for 5 to 10 minutes, watching them to make sure they do not burn.
steps.content: Cook sardines for 5 to 10 minutes, watching them to make sure they do not burn. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).
steps.content: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).

steps.title: Brush an oven-safe pan with olive oil while the oven warms up.
steps.content: Brush an oven-safe pan with olive oil while the oven warms up.

steps.title: Place your fish side-by-side in the baking pan.
steps.content: Place your fish side-by-side in the baking pan.

steps.title: Cook sardines in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
steps.content: Cook sardines in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. [7] X Research source
